justification: "The EEG was recorded during the classic monetary choice questionnaire (MCQ-27)…" indicating the MCQ-27 is the instrument used to assess DD.
The methods section lists "the DD-task (Kirby et al., 1999)" as part of the protocol, showing this task operationalises DD.
The introduction states, "Intertemporal choice questionnaires are administered to measure DD," directly tying such questionnaires to the DD construct.
The apparatus section notes participants completed the "BIS/BAS questionnaire," which provides scores for the BIS construct.
The same BIS/BAS questionnaire supplies BAS scores, linking the BAS construct to this measure.
Participants filled out an "alcohol use questionnaire (Lemmens et al., 1992)," identifying this scale as the measure of alcohol use.
The procedure lists a dedicated "smoking questionnaire," showing this instrument captures the smoking behaviour construct.
"The ERN is a negative deflection in the ERP… understood to reflect error detection," demonstrating ERN is used to measure error monitoring.
"The Pe occurs 200 ms–400 ms post-response and is associated with the motivational importance of errors," linking the Pe component to the error monitoring construct.
The text notes theta-band EROs "have been found to reflect the underlying computational processes that are involved in error monitoring," identifying theta power as a measure of this construct.
